constituent: nitrate, stone, rock, resemblance, spark, candle, small, little, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
heisigStory: The word nitrate should immediately suggest a beaker of nitric acid, which, as every high-school chemistry student knows, can eat its way through some pretty tough substances. Here we imagine pouring it over a rock and watching the sparks fly as it bores a hole through the rock.
koohiiStory1: That stone has sparks coming out of it! Someone must have poured nitrate acid on it.
koohiiStory2: Salpetre is the common name for Nitrate coming from Latin "sal petrae" or stone salt. It is also a component of gun powder so including a candle in this kanji can be quite explosive!
